addStakingContract(address).details: Staking contract is not implemented yet

params.perp: Market to add to the list of supported market

changePosition(uint256,uint256,uint256,u.details: No number for the leverage is given but the amount in the vault must be bigger than minMarginAtCreation

params.amount: Amount in vQuote (if LONG) or vBase (if SHORT) to sell. 18 decimals
params.direction: Whether the trader wants to go in the LONG or SHORT direction overall
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept. 18 decimals
Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept, in vQuote if LONG, in vBase if SHORT. 18 decimals
params.proposedAmount: Amount of tokens to be sold, in vBase if LONG, in vQuote if SHORT. 18 decimals

params.amount: Amount to be used as collateral. Might not be 18 decimals
params.token: Token to be used for the collateral

params.collateralAmount: Amount to be used as the collateral of the position. Might not be 18 decimals
params.direction: Whether the position is LONG or SHORT
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept. 18 decimals
params.positionAmount: Amount to be sold, in vQuote (if LONG) or vBase (if SHORT). Must be 18 decimals
params.token: Token to be used for the collateral of the position

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.liquidatee: Address of the account to liquidate
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept. 18 decimals
params.proposedAmount: Amount of tokens to be sold, in vBase if LONG, in vQuote if SHORT. 18 decimals

params.liquidatee: Address of the account to liquidate
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept. 18 decimals
params.proposedAmount: Amount of tokens to be sold, in vBase if LONG, in vQuote if SHORT. 18 decimals

params.closeMinAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept when closing the position. 18 decimals
params.closeProposedAmount: Amount in vQuote (if LONG) or vBase (if SHORT) to sell to close the position. 18 decimals
params.direction: Whether the trader wants to go in the LONG or SHORT direction overall
params.openMinAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept when opening the reversed position. 18 decimals
params.openProposedAmount: Amount in vQuote (if LONG) or vBase (if SHORT) to sell to open the reversed position. 18 decimals

pause().details: Can only be called by Manager

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.amounts: Amount of virtual tokens ([vQuote, vBase]) provided. 18 decimals
params.minLpAmount: Minimum amount of Lp tokens minted. 18 decimals

params.liquidityAmountToRemove: Amount of liquidity (in LP tokens) to be removed from the pool. 18 decimals
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept when closing his active position        generated after removing liquidity, in vQuote if LONG, in vBase if SHORT. 18 decimals
params.minVTokenAmounts: Minimum amount of virtual tokens [vQuote, vBase] to withdraw from the curve pool. 18 decimals
params.proposedAmount: Amount at which to sell the active LP position (in vBase if LONG, in vQuote if SHORT). 18 decimals

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.liquidatee: Address of the account to liquidate

settleDust(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8.details: Can only be called by Manager

params.idx: Index of the perpetual market to sell dust from
params.minAmount: Minimum amount that the user is willing to accept, in vQuote if LONG, in vBase if SHORT. 18 decimals
params.proposedAmount: Amount of tokens to be sold, in vBase if LONG, in vQuote if SHORT. 18 decimals

unpause().details: Can only be called by Manager

params.amount: Amount of collateral to withdraw. Might not be 18 decimals (decimals of `token`)

withdrawAll(address).details: Should only be called by the trader

insuranceRatio.details: Once the insurance reserve exceed this ratio of the tvl, governance can withdraw exceeding insurance fee

liquidationReward.details: Paid on dollar value of an trader position. important: liquidationReward < minMargin or liquidations will result in protocol losses

nonUACollSeizureDiscount.details: Must be lower than liquidationDiscount to ensure liquidations don't generate bad debt

ClearingHouse_AmountProvidedTooLarge().notice: Emitted when a user attempts to provide liquidity with amount larger than his free collateral or collateral balance

ClearingHouse_ChangePositionZeroAmount().notice: Emitted when a user attempts to change his position with no amount

ClearingHouse_ClosePositionStillOpen().notice: Emitted when the position is not reduced entirely using closePositionWithdrawCollateral

ClearingHouse_ExcessiveLiquidationDiscou.notice: Emitted when the liquidationDiscount is too high

ClearingHouse_ExcessiveLiquidationReward.notice: Emitted when the proposed share of the liquidation reward for the insurance is too high

ClearingHouse_ExcessivePositiveOpenNotio.notice: Emitted when the proposed minimum open notional is too high

ClearingHouse_ExtendPositionInsufficient.notice: Emitted when there is not enough margin to extend to the proposed position amount

ClearingHouse_ExtendPositionZeroAmount().notice: Emitted when a user attempts to extend their position with amount equal to 0

ClearingHouse_InsufficientDiffBtwLiquida.notice: Emitted when the difference between liquidationDiscount and nonUACollSeizureDiscount isn't large enough

ClearingHouse_InsufficientUaDebtSeizureT.notice: Emitted when the proposed UA debt limit is lower than the minimum acceptable value

ClearingHouse_InvalidInsuranceRatio().notice: Emitted when the proposed insurance ratio is too low or too high

ClearingHouse_InvalidLiquidationReward().notice: Emitted when the proposed liquidation reward is too low or too high

ClearingHouse_InvalidMinMargin().notice: Emitted when the proposed minMargin is too low or too high

ClearingHouse_InvalidMinMarginAtCreation.notice: Emitted when the proposed minMarginAtCreation is too low or too high

ClearingHouse_LiquidateInsufficientPropo.notice: Emitted when the attempted liquidation does not close the full position

ClearingHouse_LiquidateInvalidPosition().notice: Emitted when the liquidatee does not have an open position

ClearingHouse_LiquidateValidMargin().notice: Emitted when the margin of the liquidatee's position is still valid

ClearingHouse_LiquidationDebtSizeZero().notice: Emitted when a collateral liquidation for a user with no UA debt is tried

ClearingHouse_NegativeDustProceeds().notice: Emitted when governance tries to sell dust with a negative balance

ClearingHouse_PerpetualMarketAlreadyAssi.notice: Emitted when passing the address of a perpetual market which has already been added

ClearingHouse_ProvideLiquidityZeroAmount.notice: Emitted when a user attempts to provide liquidity with amount equal to 0

ClearingHouse_ReducePositionZeroAmount().notice: Emitted when a user attempts to reduce their position with amount equal to 0

ClearingHouse_RemoveLiquidityInsufficien.notice: Emitted when a user attempts to withdraw more liquidity than they have

ClearingHouse_SufficientUserCollateral().notice: Emitted when a liquidator tries seizing collateral of user with sufficient collaterals level

ClearingHouse_UnderOpenNotionalAmountReq.notice: Emitted when a user tries to open a position with an incorrect open notional amount

ClearingHouse_WithdrawInsufficientMargin.notice: Emitted when there is not enough margin to withdraw the requested amount

ClearingHouse_ZeroAddress().notice: Emitted when the zero address is provided

PRBMathSD59x18__AbsInputTooSmall().notice: Emitted when the input is MIN_SD59x18.

PRBMathSD59x18__MulInputTooSmall().notice: Emitted when one of the inputs is MIN_SD59x18.

PRBMathSD59x18__MulOverflow(uint256).notice: Emitted when the intermediary absolute result overflows SD59x18.

PRBMath__MulDivFixedPointOverflow(uint25.notice: Emitted when the result overflows uint256.

ChangePosition(uint256,address,uint8,int.notice: Emitted when a position is opened/extended

DustSold(uint256,int256,int256).notice: Emitted when dust is sold by governance

LiquidationCall(uint256,address,address,.notice: Emitted when an user position is liquidated

MarketAdded(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when new perpetual market is added

SeizeCollateral(address,address).notice: Emitted when an user non-UA collaterals are seized

allowListPerpetual(address).notice: Add one perpetual market to the list of markets

changePosition(uint256,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Open or increase or reduce a position, either LONG or SHORT

closePositionWithdrawCollateral(uint256,.notice: Single close position function, groups closing position and withdrawing collateralImportant: `proposedAmount` must be large enough to close the entire position else the function call will fail

extendPositionWithCollateral(uint256,uin.notice: Single open position function, groups depositing collateral and extending position

getDebtAcrossMarkets(address).notice: Get user debt across all perpetual markets

getFreeCollateralByRatio(address,int256).notice: Get free collateral of a user given a chosen margin ratio

getNumMarkets().notice: Return the number of active markets

getPnLAcrossMarkets(address).notice: Get user profit/loss across all perpetual markets

getTotalMarginRequirement(address,int256.notice: Get the margin required to serve user debt at a chosen margin ratio

liquidateLp(uint256,address,uint256[2],u.notice: Submit the address of a LP whose position is worth liquidating for a reward

liquidateTrader(uint256,address,uint256,.notice: Submit the address of an Trader whose position is worth liquidating for a reward

liquidationDiscount().notice: Discount on the collateral price for the liquidator

liquidationRewardInsuranceShare().notice: Portion of the liquidation reward that the insurance gets

minMarginAtCreation().notice: minimum margin when opening a position

minPositiveOpenNotional().notice: minimum positive open notional when opening a position

nonUACollSeizureDiscount().notice: Discount ratio to be applied on non-UA collaterals before seizing said collaterals for some UA

openReversePosition(uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Open a position in the opposite direction of the currently opened positionFor example, a trader with a LONG position can switch to a SHORT position with just one call to this function

provideLiquidity(uint256,uint256[2],uint.notice: Provide liquidity to the pool, without depositing new capital in the vault

removeLiquidity(uint256,uint256,uint256[.notice: Remove liquidity from the pool and account profit/loss in UA

seizeCollateral(address).notice: Buy the non-UA collaterals of a user at a discounted UA price to settle the debt of said user

setParameters((int256,int256,uint256,uin.notice: Update the value of the param listed in `IClearingHouse.ClearingHouseParams`

settleDust(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8.notice: Sell dust of a given market

uaDebtSeizureThreshold().notice: UA debt amount at which non-UA collaterals can be seized to pay back UA debts

withdrawAll(address).notice: Withdraw all tokens from the vault

userdoc.notice: Entry point for users to vault and perpetual markets
